data:
Persuader: Hey, how's it going?
	Persuadee: Good, how are you?
Persuader: Good here as well.
Persuader: Do you have a moment to chat about children causes?
	Persuadee: Sure thing.
	Persuadee: What are they?
Persuader: I'd like to talk about children who weren't born with the same as opportunities.
Persuader: Particularly children who go hungry everyday and have no place to live.
Persuader: How does that make you feel?
	Persuadee: It sucks that not all people and children have the comfort of having a stable place to stay or the comfort of knowing they are able to eat.
	Persuadee: It is sad.
Persuader: What was life like for you growing up?
Persuader: Did you ever have to worry about having enough to eat or having a safe place to live?
	Persuadee: I did not have to worry about those things.
	Persuadee: Both of my parents were employed and were able to provide for me and my siblings.
Persuader: I felt safe and secure in my home.
Persuader: That is absolutely wonderful.
Persuader: I feel many people take that for granted.
Persuader: Not having to worry about those things while growing up.
	Persuadee: It is not a problem just for children.
	Persuadee: There are many homeless adults and adolescents that do not know where their next meal is coming from, or if it will ever arrive.
Persuader: It would be great if we could work together to assure that everyone have at least those basic necessities met.
	Persuadee: How do you suppose we do that?
Persuader: We can't help everyone, but we can focus one cause at a time.
Persuader: A cause that you believe in.
Persuader: Have you ever of Save the Children?
	Persuadee: I have not heard of Save the Children?
	Persuadee: What do they do?
Persuader: Save the Children is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.
	Persuadee: That sounds like a good organization.
	Persuadee: I'm sure they do a lot of nice work.
Persuader: Would you like to help and donate to them?
Persuader: Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment.
Persuader: You can choose any amount from $0.50 to all your payment.
	Persuadee: I am not willing to donate from my study payment as this money is vital to me.
	Persuadee: I am sorry I am unable to help.
Persuader: That is understandable.
	Persuadee: Thank you for your time and information!

data:
Persuader: Hi, I would like to speak to you about a wonderful charity called "save the children".
	Persuadee: Hey hows it?
	Persuadee: Yeah I am interested to hear more.
Persuader: When you give to Save the Children, you're investing in a future for every last child.Nearly 90% of every dollar you give goes straight to our mission ??Â¸??Â¸ helping children grow up healthy, learning and safe.
	Persuadee: Nearly 90?
	Persuadee: Where does the other money go?
Persuader: The rest?
Persuader: We use to support the mission ??Â¸??Â¸ running our programs and raising funds to help more children.
	Persuadee: Well that is good.
	Persuadee: I like that information out there.
Persuader: Giving to Save the Children is one of the world's best investments.
Persuader: Changing children's lives now.
Persuader: Transforming the future we all share.
	Persuadee: There are many charities for children than just that one.
Persuader: In 2017 alone, Save the Children reached more than 155 million children in 120 countries, including the U.S.
Persuader: Results like these are only possible because of giving people like you.
Persuader: Whether you give a little or a lot.
Persuader: Every gift makes a world of difference for a child in need.
	Persuadee: Wow thats way more than I would have thought.
Persuader: I know, it is a really great organization.
Persuader: Do you think you'd be willing to donate today?
	Persuadee: Yes I would be willing to donate.
Persuader: How about $.15 today?
	Persuadee: I can do that
Persuader: Awesome, you are making a world of difference for children around the world.
	Persuadee: Well it is not much but if everyone would give a little it would make a huge difference in this world we live in.
Persuader: You're absolutely right.
Persuader: Most people would not even notice the money missing.
	Persuadee: Right on so I will give $0.15  :)
Persuader: I will match your contribution.
	Persuadee: That is what I like to hear!
Persuader: I hope you have a wonderful day.
Persuader: Thank you for your kindness.
	Persuadee: You too,  was a pleasure!

data:
Persuader: Hi, How are you today?
	Persuadee: Hi!
	Persuadee: I'm great, how are you?
Persuader: I'm terrific!
Persuader: I wanted to talk to you today about a charity I am really involved in
	Persuadee: Okay, please tell me about the charity.
Persuader: This charity is called Save the Children and is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.
Persuader: Do you ever donate to charity organizations?
	Persuadee: I almost never donate.
	Persuadee: Do you?
Persuader: I definitely do if I believe in the mission of the organization.
Persuader: This particular organization is helping the future of our world by ensuring that children's rights are protected all over
	Persuadee: That sounds really great.
	Persuadee: I would be willing to donate to this organization.
Persuader: That's amazing!
Persuader: How much would you like to donate to the charity now?
Persuader: Your donation would be directly deducted from your task payment.
Persuader: You can choose any amount!
	Persuadee: I'd like to donate $0.50
Persuader: That is fantastic, thank you!
Persuader: The researchers running this task will make sure that the organization receives your donation!
	Persuadee: Awesome!
	Persuadee: So how exactly does the organization ensure that children's rights are protected?
Persuader: In the U.S. and around the world, they give children a healthy start in life, the opportunity to learn and protection from harm.
Persuader: When crisis strikes, they are always among the first to respond and the last to leave.
Persuader: We do whatever it takes to save children, transforming their lives and the future we share.
	Persuadee: Wow, that is amazing.
	Persuadee: How long have you been involved?
Persuader: I've been involved with the organization for about a year now and have learned so much about their mission.
Persuader: They help children here at home and abroad
	Persuadee: And what do you do at the organization?
Persuader: I help promote the organization by speaking to people just like you and helping to generate donations.
Persuader: Since the organization is not for profit, donations from individuals and organizations help them acheive their mission
	Persuadee: Good for you!
	Persuadee: I would definitely love to donate and get involved in any way I can.
Persuader: that is great!
Persuader: I would like to personally thank you for your donation today!
	Persuadee: No problem!
	Persuadee: Thank you!
	Persuadee: I will donate 50 cents

data:
Persuader: It would be really great if we gave some money to save the children
	Persuadee: Can you tell me more about what they do?
Persuader: Save the Children is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.
	Persuadee: Sounds like they accomplish great things.
	Persuadee: Are you thinking of a one time donation?
Persuader: yes it would be a one time donation that will be taken from the payment from the task.
Persuader: You can decide to give part of the payment to save the children and keep part for yourself.
	Persuadee: I see, so I am thinking of donating half.
	Persuadee: What are your thoughts?
Persuader: I think half is a good idea I will do the same thing
	Persuadee: I think it is important to do all we can to help children.
	Persuadee: Are we being selfish by keeping half?
Persuader: maybe there are children who may die without this money
	Persuadee: That's true.
	Persuadee: I still haven't decided for sure though.
	Persuadee: Sometimes I question the actual impact of money donated to charities.
Persuader: ? At least you know some of this money will go to save lives
	Persuadee: I guess so.
	Persuadee: Have you donated to Save the Children before?
Persuader: no and i regret that i've been so selfish
	Persuadee: Well, don't feel bad.
	Persuadee: We will donate today.
	Persuadee: I propose we stick with our half plan.
	Persuadee: What do you think?
Persuader: yes i like that plan
	Persuadee: OK, so that will be one dollar each, right?
Persuader: yes it would be a dollar from each of us
	Persuadee: OK sounds good.
	Persuadee: You sure?
Persuader: yes i am sure.
Persuader: we have a moral responsibility to help
	Persuadee: Right, nice chatting with you.
	Persuadee: I'm proud of us.
	Persuadee: I'm proud too.nice working with you.
Persuader: I'm proud too.
Persuader: nice working with you.

data:
Persuader: Hello, how ware you today?
	Persuadee: Hello, I'm alright.
Persuader: Do you consider yourself someone that wants to make a change in the world?
	Persuadee: Yes somewhat.
	Persuadee: With e environment and food system.
	Persuadee: What do you think of children's charities?
Persuader: I think some are good but i've been donating to Save the Children (foundation).
Persuader: Have you ever heard of them?
	Persuadee: I think I have.
	Persuadee: I've heard of Red Cross
Persuader: It is similar in which all funds donated are used to help kids in need.
	Persuadee: That's nice.
	Persuadee: How much would you donate if given the chance to help a childrens charity?
Persuader: i'm not sure i already donate my time.
	Persuadee: Oh ok.
	Persuadee: Do you have any other questions?
Persuader: yes, have you heard about the crisis in syria?
	Persuadee: Is it about the civil war in Syria?
Persuader: Children are being hit with bombs they are looking for help in war zones
	Persuadee: Thats horrible.. Is this recent?
	Persuadee: Is America helping?
Persuader: not as much as they should.
Persuader: Given the chance would you be willing to donate some of your task payment to organizations like save the children?
	Persuadee: Sure.
	Persuadee: I would.
Persuader: choosing anywhere between $0 and all of your payment, how much would you like to donate?
	Persuadee: Ill donate $1
Persuader: Ok, your donation to Save the Children is greatly appreciated!
Persuader: One day at a time, people like you will help make the world a better place.
	Persuadee: Yes they will
Persuader: Have a wonderful day
